H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H551.def: = marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H7814.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H8549.def: = state in which an object is fully, unaffected and undiminished in its shape and form

H7600.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance

H937.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H6248.def: = process by which humans reflect on the things that they perceive

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4571.def: = causative action by which deities cause the loins of humans shake

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H7951.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H987.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H199.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1709.def: = collective designation of various cold-blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H974.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H2938.def: = process by which the flavor of food is perceived, when eating

H400.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3453.def: = state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ often associated with wisdom and respectability

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H753.def: = the greater or greatest of two or more dimensions of an object

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2040.def: = state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H6113.def: = action by which someone slows down or stops moving forward entirely

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H7683.def: = action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

H232.def: = piece of cloth ► wrapped around the waist to cover the private parts; commonly worn by slaves; ≈ associated with low status

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H386.def: = state of not being subject to change

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H2940.def: = the flavor characteristics of certain types of food

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H937.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7679.def: = causative process by which deities causes a nation to be regarded with respect

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H7849.def: = causative action by which humans cause a substance or a set of small objects to divide itself and move into various directions

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H8414.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

H4959.def: = action by which humans examine a place or object by touching ◄ usually as a result of being unable to see

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7910.def: = state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol
